notes: Condra, Long, Shaver, Wright (2018) 'The Logic of Insurgent Electoral Violence', AER. Two distinct IV strategies: (1) Table 2 uses wind speed at 4:30 AM (plus_wind_00Z_10) as instrument for morning insurgent attacks (df_5to11) on voter turnout, at the district-election level with election FE, clustered by district; (2) Table 3 uses nighttime cloud cover (cloudz_perc_election) as instrument for IED deployment near roads (post_event_indicator) on vote totals at polling-station-road-segment level with district FE, robust and clustered SEs. Tables 6-7 are cross-sectional survey regressions (secondary, not IV).

bundle.notes: Controls and FE are shared across first stage and second stage. Weather controls at other times of day are exogenous regressors in both stages.

claim_object.outcome_concept: Voter turnout (total_v2_agcho10: total votes as share of age-cohort population, v2 measure)
claim_object.treatment_concept: Morning insurgent attacks (df_5to11: attacks between 5-11 AM on election day)
claim_object.estimand_concept: LATE of election-day insurgent attacks on voter turnout, using wind speed as instrument for attack timing
claim_object.target_population: Afghan districts that held elections and experienced some disruption (no_voting_either==0 & disrupt==1)

baseline_specs.label: Table2-Col4-2SLS
baseline_specs.notes: Preferred specification: full quadratic weather controls + pre-14-day wind + population + election FE. Clustered by DISTID.

constraints.notes: Minimum is linear weather controls + population (Col 2 of Table 2: 10 controls). Maximum is full quadratic weather + pre-14-day wind + population (Col 4: 18 controls). Weather controls are critical for the exclusion restriction (wind must affect turnout only through attacks). Linkage: controls appear in both first and second stage.

canonical.notes: Cluster at the district level. Matches the paper's main Table 2 specification.

budgets.notes: Control pool is structured by the exclusion-restriction logic (weather controls). Variations come from control progressions, alternative outcomes/treatments, sample definitions, and estimator choice.

sampling.notes: Control progressions follow the paper's revealed table structure (linear -> quadratic -> +pre14D). Drop-one checks on individual controls. Full enumeration feasible.

diagnostics_plan.notes: Kleibergen-Paap F-stat. Reported in paper for each specification.
Reduced-form effect of wind on non-disrupted district outcomes (SI Table 6). Placebo/falsification test.
Wind speed does not predict disruption indicator itself (SI Table 4).

bundle.notes: Controls and district FE shared across both stages. Baseline reports both robust and clustered SEs.

claim_object.outcome_concept: Vote totals at polling stations near roads (total_votes_wins: total votes for winning candidates)
claim_object.treatment_concept: IED deployment near road segments (post_event_indicator: whether an IED was found/detonated near the road segment around the election)
claim_object.estimand_concept: LATE of IED deployment on voting at nearby polling stations, using nighttime cloud cover as instrument for IED placement
claim_object.target_population: Polling-station-road-segment pairs in Afghanistan (excluding closed stations and those without weather stations)

baseline_specs.label: Table3-Col3-2SLS-WithRain
baseline_specs.notes: Preferred 2SLS specification with rainfall controls, district FE. Reports both robust and clustered (pc_clust_thiessen) SEs.

constraints.notes: Minimum: geographic controls without rain (ht_route_indicator, rcv2, population_v2, shape_leng, pre_event_indicator_6m_V2). Maximum: + march_rain + march_rain2. Linkage across stages.

canonical.notes: Heteroskedasticity-robust SEs. This is the primary inference in Table 3 (with clustered SEs reported separately as a robustness check).

variants.notes: Cluster at Thiessen polygon level. Reported alongside robust SEs in Table 3.

budgets.notes: Smaller control set than G1. Variations come from control LOO, alternative outcomes (clean vote counts, corruption), sample conditions, and estimator choice.

sampling.notes: Small control pool (5-7 controls). Full enumeration of leave-one-out and progressions.

diagnostics_plan.notes: K-P F-stat reported for each IV specification.
Weak-IV robust p-value via Anderson-Rubin test (weakiv command). Reported in paper.
Cloud cover reduced form on non-disrupted areas (SI Table 24). Placebo.
Cloud cover on corruption perception (SI Table 25). Tests exclusion restriction.
